meanings.definition: To trail or drag along the ground.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog would drail its leash behind it.
meanings.sent2: The children loved to drail their sticks in the sand at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The snail decided to drail its shell along the garden path for a change.
meanings.sent4: The fallen leaves seemed to drail along the sidewalk in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The old car's bumper would drail noisily as it drove down the bumpy road.

meanings.definition: A small metal rod used in weaving.
meanings.sent1: The weaver carefully inserted the drail into the loom.
meanings.sent2: She needed a new drail for her weaving project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten batted the drail across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The drail gleamed in the sunlight as it held the threads in place.
meanings.sent5: The drail clinked softly as it was moved from one side of the loom to the other.

meanings.sent1: The heavy truck began to drail up the steep hill.
meanings.sent2: The tired hiker had to drail through the thick mud.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy sloth seemed to drail along the tree branches.
meanings.sent4: The time seemed to drail as she waited for the train.
meanings.sent5: The old man would drail his feet as he walked down the street.
